Disallownewoperators with theFunctionobject
Table of ContentsRule DetailsWhen Not To Use ItVersionResources
Itâ€™s possible to create functions in JavaScript from strings at runtime using theFunctionconstructor, such as:
consta=newFunction("a","b","return a + b");constb=Function("a","b","return a + b");constc=Function.call(null,"a","b","return a + b");constd=Function.apply(null,["a","b","return a + b"]);constx=Function.bind(null,"a","b","return a + b")();12345Copy code to clipboard
This is considered by many to be a bad practice due to the difficulty in debugging and reading these types of functions. In addition, Content-Security-Policy (CSP) directives may disallow the use ofeval()and similar methods for creating code from strings.
